alert.note: Alert for Eastern Douglas County Foothills (Oregon) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Medford (Southwest Oregon and Northern California)
info.headline: Winter Storm Watch issued March 12 at 2:07AM PDT until March 14 at 2:00AM PDT by NWS Medford
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WATCH IN EFFECT FROM MONDAY MORNING THROUGH LATE MONDAY NIGHT ABOVE 3500 FEET... * WHAT...Heavy snow possible above 3500 feet. Total snow accumulations of 5 to 10 inches possible. Winds could gust as high as 40 mph. * WHERE...Eastern Douglas County Foothills above 3500 feet. * WHEN...From late Monday morning through late Monday night. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult due to slippery road conditions. * View the hazard area in detail at https://www.wrh.noaa.gov/map/?wfo=mfr
info.instruction: * Stock emergency kit with tire chains, flashlight, batteries, blankets, food, water, and medications. * The safest place during a winter storm is indoors. * Plan now to avoid traveling during the storm. * A Winter Storm Watch means there is potential for significant snow accumulations that may create dangerous travel.
